dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Kazakhstan's Cybercrime Department has made a massive bust, arresting over 140 people for selling citizens' personal data.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Kazakhstan's Cybercrime Department has made a massive bust, arresting over one hundred forty people for selling citizens' personal data.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: More than 140 people have been detained, including company owners and channel administrators. Currently, five individuals have been arrested, he specified.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, and it was a joint operation with the National Security Committee, right? That's a pretty serious collaboration.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, and it was a joint operation with the National Security Committee, right? That's a pretty serious collaboration.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The Cybercrime Counteraction Department of the Ministry of Internal Affairs, in cooperation with the National Security Committee, has dismantled a criminal group engaged in the illegal sale of Kazakhstani citizens' personal data online.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Exactly. And they got the data from government databases, which is uh, a huge red flag about internal security protocols.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Exactly. And they got the data from government databases, which is uh, a huge red flag about internal security protocols.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: According to Zhandos Suyinbay, head of the Cybercrime Department of the Ministry of Internal Affairs, the data was obtained from government databases and distributed via Telegram channels, including being shared with certain debt collection agencies.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Right, and then they were distributing it on Telegram channels. I mean, that's just so brazen.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Right, and then they were distributing it on Telegram channels. I mean, that's just so brazen.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: According to Zhandos Suyinbay, head of the Cybercrime Department of the Ministry of Internal Affairs, the data was obtained from government databases and distributed via Telegram channels, including being shared with certain debt collection agencies.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: And some of that data was shared with debt collection agencies, which is like adding insult to injury for those affected.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And some of that data was shared with debt collection agencies, which is like adding insult to injury for those affected.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: According to Zhandos Suyinbay, head of the Cybercrime Department of the Ministry of Internal Affairs, the data was obtained from government databases and distributed via Telegram channels, including being shared with certain debt collection agencies.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: They seized over 400 electronic devices during searches—computers, phones, you name it. That's a ton of evidence.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: They seized over four hundred electronic devices during searches-computers, phones, you name it. That's a ton of evidence.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: He added that during searches of collection agencies, law enforcement officers seized over 400 computer and other electronic devices.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Five people are already under arrest, including company owners and channel operators. But the investigation is still ongoing to find everyone involved.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Five people are already under arrest, including company owners and channel operators. But the investigation is still ongoing to find everyone involved.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Currently, five individuals have been arrested, he specified. The investigation to identify all individuals involved is ongoing, Suyinbay noted.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: It's wild how much personal information was just floating around out there. The ministry says they're gonna keep cracking down on these leaks.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: It's wild how much personal information was just floating around out there. The ministry says they're gonna keep cracking down on these leaks.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The ministry assured that it will continue targeted efforts to prevent personal data leaks and suppress illegal activities that violate the digital security of citizens.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Which is good, because digital security is just so vulnerable these days. People's data shouldn't be up for sale like that.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Which is good, because digital security is just so vulnerable these days. People's data shouldn't be up for sale like that.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Absolutely. And this case really highlights how organized these groups can be—it wasn't just some random hackers.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Absolutely. And this case really highlights how organized these groups can be-it wasn't just some random hackers.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: No, it sounds like a well-structured operation, pulling from official sources and everything. Scary stuff.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: No, it sounds like a well-structured operation, pulling from official sources and everything. Scary stuff.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Let's hope this sends a message to others thinking about doing the same.
